poem:
**The Tabloids of Tomorrow**

They squabble and grasp for crowns of straw,
under the conference lights, dimmed by doubt.
Not quite actors, nor quite leaders, yet all
playing parts in a reality where applause is scarce.
Their titles borrowed, not won. 
And like fleeting names in ink,
they disappear before the credits roll.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Some veteran figures have decided to give this weekend’s conference in Birmingham a miss, fearing the party has learned little from the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
